QuestionStem: In addition to a cell membrane, cytoplasm, nucleus, and mitochondria, a plant cell also has a cell wall and chloroplasts.

content.imageAlt: In this activity, there is an illustration of a plant cell. You can click on the hotspots for more information about the cell's structures and organelles.

panels.title: Chloroplast
panels.description: In the cells of plants and a few other kinds of organisms, chloroplasts capture energy from sunlight and change it into food that stores energy for the cell to use.
panels.imageAlt: This magnified image shows a chloroplast. It is a sac-like structure that contains many dark green squares.

panels.title: Cell wall
panels.description: A cell wall surrounds the entire plant cell, including its cell membrane, and supports the plant cell. Most bacterial cells, which are prokaryotic, also have cell walls.
panels.imageAlt: This magnified image shows rectangular-shaped cells, each with internal structures, separated by rigid cell walls.

panels.title: Vacuole
panels.description: A large central vacuole is bound by a membrane and contains materials and waste. It also maintains adequate pressure inside the plant cell.
